basics.name: Andrés Felipe Arias Russi
basics.label: Computer Science and Systems Engineering, and Mathematics Student

work.name: Cornell Tech
work.summary: Contributed to the development of an interface designed to connect with a crash cart, aiming to assist healthcare workers in emergencies. Conducted user tests to evaluate the interface's effectiveness and worked on integrating semi-autonomous control for the robot in a 'Wizard of Oz' setup.

work.name: Universidad de los Andes
work.position: Teaching Assistant - Algorithm Design and Analysis
work.summary: Assisted in grading assignments, clarifying students' doubts, and providing supplementary lessons to reinforce understanding of algorithms and data structures. Ensured students grasped problem-solving techniques and algorithmic concepts.

work.name: Universidad de los Andes
work.summary: Instructed a class of approximately 30 students in Differential Calculus, developing course materials and assessments to enhance understanding and application of key mathematical concepts.

work.name: Robocol - Universidad de los Andes Robotics Group
work.summary: Worked on image processing algorithms and deep learning models (YOLO, CNNs) for computer vision tasks in the Vision Subsystem. Collaborated on robotics competitions and projects, enhancing teamwork and technical skills.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

certificates.name: Divide and Conquer, Sorting and Searching, and Randomized Algorithms
Building Transformer-Based Natural Language Processing Applications

publications.name: Bridging the Gap in Health Literacy: Harnessing the Power of Large Language Models to Generate Plain Language Summaries from Biomedical Texts
publications.summary: Health literacy is key to making informed health decisions, but complex medical info can be hard for many to understand. This study found that using NLP and GPT models can help automate the process of creating simpler, easy-to-understand summaries, showing promise for improving health literacy and making healthcare info more accessible to everyone.

references.name: Professor Rubén Manrique @ Uniandes
references.reference: Supervised my thesis in Computer Science, focused on the use of different NLP techniques and LLMs to improve health literacy.

references.name: Professor Angelique Taylor @ Cornell Tech
references.reference: Supervisor of my research work at Cornell Tech, focusing on developing interfaces for tele-operating robots in medical environments.

references.name: Professor Mauricio Junca @ Uniandes
references.reference: Currently supervising my Mathematics thesis on optimal transport and variational inference.

references.name: Professor Jorge Duitama @ Uniandes
references.reference: I was his TA for one year in the Design and Analysis of Algorithms course.
